overview.title: Overview
overview.p1: pixel art Village respects your privacy. This policy explains what data we process, how we use cookies (including Google AdSense cookies), and your choices. If you have questions, please contact us via the email on the Contact page.

local.title: Local Image Processing
local.p1: Your images never leave your device. All image processing happens locally in your browser. We do not upload, store, or share your image files on our servers.

collect.title: Information We Collect
collect.li1: Technical data for site operation (e.g., basic device/browser info) necessary to deliver the service.
collect.li2: Usage data in aggregate to improve features (if analytics is enabled, we avoid collecting personally identifiable information).
collect.li3: Advertising data from Google AdSense (see below) if ads are displayed.
collect.p2: We do not require account registration. We do not knowingly collect sensitive personal data.

cookies.title: Cookies and AdSense
cookies.p1: We may use cookies and similar technologies to operate the website and improve your experience. If Google AdSense is enabled, Google and its partners may use cookies to serve ads based on your visits to this and other sites.
cookies.learn: Learn how Google uses information from sites or apps that use Google services:
cookies.more: More on Google ads and cookies:

third.title: Third‑Party Partners
third.p1: We may integrate third‑party services (e.g., Google AdSense). These partners may process data under their own privacy policies. We encourage you to review their policies to understand data handling practices.

use.title: Data Use and Sharing
use.li2: Safeguard service integrity, detect abuse, and improve features.
use.li3: Comply with legal obligations. We do not sell personal data.

rights.title: Your Choices and Rights
rights.li1: Opt‑out or manage ad personalization using the links above.
rights.li2: Control cookies via your browser settings.
rights.li3: Contact us to exercise applicable privacy rights (access, correction, deletion as required by law).

children.title: Children’s Privacy
children.p1: The service is not directed to children under 13 (or the age required by local law). We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

changes.title: Changes to this Policy
changes.p1: We may update this policy from time to time. Material changes will be highlighted on this page with an updated date. Your continued use of the site indicates acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: For privacy inquiries, please see the Contact page.

privacy.seoDesc: pixel art Village privacy policy: local image processing, AdSense cookies, third‑party partners, your choices and rights, contact info.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.p1: By accessing or using pixel art Village (the “Service”), you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree, do not use the Service.

use.title: Use of the Service
use.li1: Upload only content you have the rights to use. You are responsible for your content and compliance with applicable laws.
use.li2: Do not abuse, interfere with, or disrupt the Service or other users.
use.li3: Do not use the Service for illegal, harmful, or infringing activities.

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.p1: We retain all rights to the Service and related materials. You retain rights to your original uploads and generated outputs, subject to your applicable rights and third‑party rights.

processing.title: Image Processing
processing.p1: Image processing is performed locally in your browser. We do not store your uploaded images on our servers.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimer.p1: The Service is provided “as is” and “as available” without warranties of any kind, express or implied. We do not warrant that the Service will be uninterrupted or error‑free.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.p1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from or related to your use of the Service.

changes.title: Changes to the Service or Terms
changes.p1: We may modify or discontinue the Service and update these Terms at any time. Continued use of the Service constitutes acceptance of updated Terms.

law.title: Governing Law
law.p1: These Terms are governed by applicable laws in your jurisdiction to the extent not preempted by other laws. Venue and jurisdiction will follow applicable conflict of laws rules.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: For questions about these Terms, please see the Contact page.

privacy.title: Privacy‑first:
privacy.desc: Your images are processed locally in your browser — we do not upload files.

performance.title: Performance:

faq.title: pixel art Village: Frequently Asked Questions

items.question: The site shows a blank page or crashes — what should I do?
items.answer: Some browser extensions inject development runtimes (e.g., Plasmo/BacklinkPilot) into every page, which can break React apps. Please disable those extensions on this site and hard‑refresh (Ctrl/Cmd+Shift+R).

items.question: Is this digital image maker with palette controls free?
items.answer: Yes. Image Art Village is a completely free online image tool for all users. Enjoy unlimited image conversions, custom palette controls, and high-resolution downloads with advanced palettes without any cost.

items.question: Is my image private? Do you upload image files?
items.answer: Your image privacy is guaranteed. Your image files never leave your device as all image processing is done locally in your browser. Image Art Village cannot access your image files, making it a secure digital image creator from your images with palette options.

items.question: How do I turn a image into a game sprite with custom palette?
items.answer: Our digital image maker with palette controls is perfect for creating game sprites. Upload your character's image, adjust the size to match your game's art style, and use the custom palette controls to fit your engine's color limits. Advanced palettes help you create the perfect sprite as a transparent PNG.

items.question: Can I adjust the pixel grid on my image?
items.answer: Absolutely. The live editor includes a "Show grid" option. This pixel grid overlay helps you see the individual pixels clearly, which is useful for fine-tuning your art or for learning how the pixelation effect works on your image.

items.question: What is the best way to convert a image to pixel art?
items.answer: For best results when you convert a image to pixel art, start with a high-contrast image. Use the pixel size slider to find a level of detail you like with custom palette settings. A larger pixel size creates a more abstract, 8-bit look, while a smaller size retains more detail from the original image with advanced palettes.

items.question: Can I use the generated pixel art commercially?
items.answer: Yes. You own the rights to your original uploads and to the generated results. You can use graphics made with pixel art Village for any purpose, including commercial projects.

items.question: Which formats can I use with this image pixelator?
items.answer: This image pixelator supports all common browser formats like PNG, JPG, GIF, and WEBP. You can convert a PNG to pixel art or a JPG to pixel art with ease.

items.question: Why is this tool called pixel art Village?
items.answer: We believe that creating graphics is a community activity, even when using a tool online. pixel art Village is a place where anyone, from beginner to pro, can gather to easily make pixel art with custom palettes. We aim to build a welcoming village for all pixel art enthusiasts.
